chainguard.platform.advisory.Reference.T.description:
- UNSPECIFIED: The "unset" value.
 - ADVISORY: Published security advisory for the vulnerability.
 - ARTICLE: Article or blog post describing the vulnerability.
 - DETECTION: Scanner or tool that allows detection in prod environments.
 - DISCUSSION: Social media discussion about vuln.
 - REPORT: Report on vuln.
 - FIX: Source code browser link to fix.
 - INTRODUCED: Source code browser link to introduction of vuln.
 - PACKAGE: Home web page for package.
 - EVIDENCE: Demonstration of validity of vuln claim.
 - WEB: Web page of unspecified kind.

aliases.title: aliases are other identifiers this vulnerability is known by

cvssSeverities.description:
css_severities are the OSV assigned CVSS severities for this vulnerability.
If not known or not assigned on OSV, this holds a single UNSPECIFIED value.

id.title: id is the CGA ID for the associated advisory

date.description: date is when the list vulnerabilities were reported as resolved.

resolvedVulns.description: resolved_vulns are the vulnerabilities marked fixed or as a false positive for the given date.

repo.description: repo is the name of the image repo.

tags.description:
tags are optional tags to specify which version of the image to filter.
If tags is empty, it is assumed the caller wants latest.

score.description: Vector string representing CVSS score based on type.

chainguard.platform.advisory.Severity.Ty.title:
- UNSPECIFIED: The "unset" value.
 - CVSS_V2: CVSS v2
 - CVSS_V3: CVSS >= 3.0 and < 4.0
 - CVSS_V4: CVSS >= 4.0 and < 5.0

id.description: id is the identifier of this specific vuln.

An APK can be downloaded by requesting
https://apk.cgr.dev/{group}/{arch}/{pkgname}-{pkgver}.apk
with suitable credentials.

The fields 10+ are the fields that make up the APKINDEX format
from here: https://wiki.alpinelinux.org/wiki/Apk_spec#APKINDEX_Format

ecdhPublicKey.description:
When establishing a headless session, the client must first provide
their ECDH public key. The server will then generate an ephemeral
ECHD keypair and use the client's public key to establish a symmetric
key.

This symmetric key will be used to encrypt the idtoken and stored the
encrypted idtoken in the database for a short period, as well as
returning it to the client.

After the idtoken is encrypted, the server will discard both the shared
symmetric key and the ephemeral ECDH private key. The server ECDH will
be sent back to the client.

The client, with their private key, can use this public key to
establish the same symmetric key, which can be used to decrypt
the idtoken.

echd_public_key is the client's ECDH public key.

static.description:
static is equivalent to literal, but instead of discovering the
IdP's verification keys we verify the identity using pre-registered
verification keys.  This is intended for use with identities from
providers without an "online" issuer (network accessible to our IdP),
such as a KinD/minikube cluster.
NOTE: because this path does not have a mechanism for key rotation
the identity will expire, with a maximum lifetime of 30d.

data, including more detailed version information.

chainguard.platform.libraries.ArtifactLi.description:
A collection of Artifacts as returned by calls to ListArtifacts.
Contains pagination fields to allow callers to request additional
pages of results if the set exceeds the requested page size or maximum
default page size.

nextPageToken.description:
A token that can be reused on subsequent requests to retrieve
the next page of results. Other filter fields must match
the call that provided this token.

skipped.description:
The number of records skipped to get to this page of results.
The is the sum of the previous page token skip (if present)
and the requested skip value.

totalArtifacts.description: The total number of artifacts that this query found.

chainguard.platform.tenant.Sbom2.description:
Sbom represents a normalized SBOM that we have ingested into our datastore.
They are linked to Signatures via ID, as in they are 'children' of Signatures
There can be multiple of these that we keep.

lastSeen.title:
last_seen tracks the timestamp at which this sbom was last seen.

chainguard.platform.vulnerabilities.v1.E.description:
- EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_UNSPECIFIED: Default/unspecified
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_DETECTION: Detection event
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_TRUE_POSITIVE_DETERMINATION: True positive determination
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_FIXED: Fixed event
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_FALSE_POSITIVE_DETERMINATION: False positive determination
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_ANALYSIS_NOT_PLANNED: Analysis not planned
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_FIX_NOT_PLANNED: Fix not planned
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_PENDING_UPSTREAM_FIX: Pending upstream fix
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_PATCHED: Patched event
chainguard.platform.vulnerabilities.v1.E.title:
EventTypeFilter represents the event types that can be used for filtering
These map to the event type values used in the system

chainguard.platform.vulnerabilities.v1.O.description:
- ORDER_BY_UNSPECIFIED: Default sort order
 - ID_ASC: Sort by ID in ascending order
 - ID_DESC: Sort by ID in descending order
 - CREATED_AT_ASC: Sort by creation time in ascending order (oldest first)
 - CREATED_AT_DESC: Sort by creation time in descending order (newest first)
 - ALIASES_ASC: Sort by aliases to group related advisories in ascending order
 - ALIASES_DESC: Sort by aliases to group related advisories in descending order
 - UPDATED_AT_ASC: Sort by delete time in ascending order (oldest first)
 - UPDATED_AT_DESC: Sort by update time in descending order (newest first)
 - DELETED_AT_ASC: Sort by delete time in ascending order (oldest first)
 - DELETED_AT_DESC: Sort by delete time in descending order (newest first)
chainguard.platform.vulnerabilities.v1.O.title: OrderBy specifies the sort order for advisory list results

chainguard.platform.vulnerabilities.v1.R.title: ReviewStatus represents the possible states of review for an advisory event

parameters.description:
One or more group scopes to restrict the returned token to.
If scope and scopes are both provided, the union of their values is
considered, after deduplication.

The returned token will include role bindings for the requested scopes,
if any exist, that are either granted directly at that scope or inherited from
its ancestors. That is, a role binding granted at a "lower" scope in the ancestry
applies to all descendants of that scope.

For example, given a role binding on group `foo` with id `foo/rb-id-1`
and a role binding on group `foo/bar` with id `foo/bar/rb-id-2`:
 - given scopes = [foo, foo/bar] => {foo: [foo/rb-id-1], foo/bar: [foo/bar/rb-id-2]}
 - given scopes = [foo/bar] => {foo/bar: [foo/rb-id-1, foo/bar/rb-id-2]}
parameters.name: scopes

parameters.description:
event_statuses filters by event review status (e.g., PENDING, REQUEST_CHANGES)
When specified, only advisories containing at least one event with any of the provided
statuses will be returned. This is useful for review workflows where users need to see
only events requiring action.
parameters.name: eventStatuses

parameters.description:
event_author filters by event author email
When specified, only advisories containing at least one event created by the specified
author will be returned. This enables users to find their own events or events from
specific team members.
parameters.name: eventAuthor

parameters.description:
event_reviewer filters by event reviewer email
When specified, only advisories containing at least one event reviewed by the specified
author will be returned. This enables users to find their own events or events from
specific team members.
parameters.name: eventReviewer

parameters.description:
event_types filters by event type
When specified, only advisories containing at least one event of any of the provided
types will be returned.

 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_UNSPECIFIED: Default/unspecified
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_DETECTION: Detection event
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_TRUE_POSITIVE_DETERMINATION: True positive determination
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_FIXED: Fixed event
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_FALSE_POSITIVE_DETERMINATION: False positive determination
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_ANALYSIS_NOT_PLANNED: Analysis not planned
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_FIX_NOT_PLANNED: Fix not planned
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_PENDING_UPSTREAM_FIX: Pending upstream fix
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_PATCHED: Patched event
parameters.name: eventTypes

parameters.description:
order_by specifies the sort order for results
Default: ID_ASC
This field affects the order of advisories returned, which is particularly useful
for pagination and review workflows.

 - ORDER_BY_UNSPECIFIED: Default sort order
 - ID_ASC: Sort by ID in ascending order
 - ID_DESC: Sort by ID in descending order
 - CREATED_AT_ASC: Sort by creation time in ascending order (oldest first)
 - CREATED_AT_DESC: Sort by creation time in descending order (newest first)
 - ALIASES_ASC: Sort by aliases to group related advisories in ascending order
 - ALIASES_DESC: Sort by aliases to group related advisories in descending order
 - UPDATED_AT_ASC: Sort by delete time in ascending order (oldest first)
 - UPDATED_AT_DESC: Sort by update time in descending order (newest first)
 - DELETED_AT_ASC: Sort by delete time in ascending order (oldest first)
 - DELETED_AT_DESC: Sort by delete time in descending order (newest first)
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.description:
exclude_event_author filters out advisories where any event was created by the specified author
When specified, advisories containing events by this author will be excluded from results.
This is useful for review workflows where users want to see all pending events except their own,
enabling them to review others' work without seeing their own submissions.
parameters.name: excludeEventAuthor

parameters.description:
latest_event_type filters out advisories where the _most recent approved event_ is
of the given type. This is useful to find advisories which are currently detected,
fixed, patched, etc.

 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_UNSPECIFIED: Default/unspecified
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_DETECTION: Detection event
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_TRUE_POSITIVE_DETERMINATION: True positive determination
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_FIXED: Fixed event
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_FALSE_POSITIVE_DETERMINATION: False positive determination
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_ANALYSIS_NOT_PLANNED: Analysis not planned
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_FIX_NOT_PLANNED: Fix not planned
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_PENDING_UPSTREAM_FIX: Pending upstream fix
 - EVENT_TYPE_FILTER_PATCHED: Patched event
parameters.name: latestEventType

parameters.description:
origin filters by origin package. Returns all advisories for packages
(including subpackages) that have this origin. For origin packages, origin equals package_name.
When specified, artifact_name filter is ignored as subpackage names are resolved server-side.
parameters.name: origin
